title: An ESIPT-active orange-emissive 2-(2′-hydroxyphenyl)imidazo[1,2-a]pyridine-derived chemodosimeter for turn-on detection of fluoride ions via desilylation
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,33312-33322
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA05823B, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Akhil A. Bhosle, Mainak Banerjee, Ankit Thakuri, Pooja D. Vishwakarma, Amrita Chatterjee
We report a new imidazo[1,2-a]pyridine-derived chemodosimeter, HIPS-Br, for the detection of F− ions. It operates by cleavage of the fluoride-recognizable tert-butyldiphenylsilane moiety to trigger orange emissions by ESIPT. LOD is 1.2 ppb.
